intro: Drakaea confluens, commonly known as the confluence spider-orchid, is an endemic species of the Australian flora. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance. The plant produces a single, erect stem with a single flower that is typically greenish-yellow in color. It is a terrestrial orchid that thrives in heathland and open forest habitats. Drakaea confluens is pollinated by thynnid wasps, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
